intro: Mycaranthes, commonly known as the "false milkweed," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apocynaceae. These plants are characterized by their milky sap, which is often latex-like and can be toxic. Mycaranthes species typically have opposite, simple leaves and produce showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. They are native to various regions in Africa and are often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
